detaileddescription.para: Here are several functions which map the real axis to the compact interval [-1,1] W_scale: sets the scale separating small frequencies (containing interesting structures) and tails

memberdef.argsstring: (freqType &Wscale, freqType w1, freqType wmax, int N)
memberdef.name: wscale_from_wmax_v1

detaileddescription.para: Makes sure that lower bound for W_scale fulfilled Wscale: current value for W_scale w1: smallest positive Matsubara frequency (for bosons: 2*M_PI*T, for fermions: M_PI*T) wmax: maximal frequency N: relates tmax to t1 by t1=tmax/N (for bosons: (nBOS-1)/2; for fermions: nFER-1)

memberdef.argsstring: (freqType &Wscale, freqType w1, freqType wmax, int N)
memberdef.name: wscale_from_wmax_v2

memberdef.argsstring: (freqType &Wscale, freqType w1, freqType wmax, int N)
memberdef.name: wscale_from_wmax_v3

memberdef.argsstring: (freqType &Wscale, freqType w1, freqType wmax, int N)
memberdef.name: wscale_from_wmax_lin
